intro: Evolvulus tenuis subsp. yucatanensis, commonly known as the Yucatan morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Yucatán Peninsula. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces small, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of blue and purple. The plant has hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with a slightly serrated edge. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often growing in disturbed habitats. Its flowers open in the morning and close by midday, giving it its common name.
